Job Title: Distribution/Warehousing Support Manager

Location: South Plainfield, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Supply Chain

Description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

Responsibilities / Main Tasks

 Responsible to lead, develop, plan and execute distribution and warehousing activities using world class internal material handling practices. Design and implement the complete internal logistic flows Define manpower and equipment requirement, taking into consideration the cost reduction and productivity targets for logistics (time studies, manning/balancing, routing, etc.) Personal and departmental KPIs development, implementation and maintenance Design and implement the logistic areas’s layouts Participate in and/or lead Kaizen events to improve operations, reduce costs, and maximize productivity Support the implementation of the continuous improvement activities Maximize the network warehouses storage capacity. Complement and support the planning department in its actions. Become an expert and/or Key User in VPS (Continuous Improvement) tools Bring innovation and creativity to the supply chain processes Work closely with the distribution network managers improving communication and supporting them in all relevant activities

Core Competencies

 Ownership Accountability: Take the lead in getting the job done and accept responsibility for personal actions, costs, and results Teamwork: Build cooperation among individuals and departments, share information and resources, and work to achieve group goals and outcomes Lean Concept Advocate: Implement Lean Manufacturing & Flow values; Foster the continuous improvement of all operational and business practices Creativity/Innovation: Reframe traditional patterns of thinking; Apply new and evolving ideas, methods, designs and technologies Attention to Details: Monitor adherence to standards; Actively check for accuracy of data received or generated Problem Solving/Decision Making: Take a well-ordered approach to solving problems; Act despite obstacles or resistance

Required Knowledge, Skills And Experience

 Bachelor degree in Engineering and 2 years’ experience in the Supply chain and or industrial engineering environment Business and administration degree and 2 years of experience in a supply chain environment Any other relevant training/ experience that could help to be fully sufficient and efficient in the position Working knowledge of SAP and PowerBI is key Capacity to travel in the USA and Canada

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

Who We Are And What We Believe In

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide. Volvo Group North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action employer. E.O.E./M/F/D/V.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

Prevost is one of North America's largest manufacturers of premium intercity touring coaches and the world leader in the production of premium motorhome and specialty conversion coaches. Prevost is fully committed to customer success through sound innovation, winning partnerships, and a passionate team. The Prevost tradition is the sum of values passed down from one generation to another since our first plant was built in Sainte-Claire, Quebec in 1924.

Experience Level (if available): None
